meanings.definition: A person who has or is thought to have superior tastes and interests in intellectual or cultural matters.
meanings.sent1: She always surrounded herself with highbrows who enjoyed discussing literature and art.
meanings.sent2: The highbrows at the museum appreciated the intricate details in the paintings.
meanings.sent3: The highbrows at the book club debated the symbolism in the novel with great enthusiasm.
meanings.sent4: Among the group of friends, she was known as the highbrow who introduced them to classical music.
meanings.sent5: The highbrows in the audience nodded in agreement during the philosophical lecture.

meanings.sent1: The highbrows magazine featured articles on sophisticated topics like opera and architecture.
meanings.sent2: She preferred highbrows discussions about history and philosophy over casual chats.
meanings.sent3: The highbrows event showcased avant-garde art pieces that left the attendees intrigued.
meanings.sent4: Her highbrows taste in movies led her to appreciate foreign films with deep meanings.
meanings.sent5: The highbrows atmosphere of the gallery attracted art enthusiasts from all over the city.
